entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character of the story. He is described as noticing a witch and observing the scene.

entities.name: rita skeeter
entities.description: A younger version of Rita Skeeter, a witch with short blonde hair and magenta robes, sucking an acid-green quill. She is described as unmistakably being Rita Skeeter.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: A person sitting beside Harry, wearing different robes. He is not explicitly named but is implied to be Dumbledore due to the context of the story.

entities.name: mr. crouch
entities.description: A person who looks more tired and fiercer than before, sitting in the trial. He is not explicitly named but is implied to be Mr. Crouch due to the context of the story.

entities.name: ludo bagman
entities.description: A person who walks into the room, described as being at the height of his Quidditch-playing fitness. He is not broken-nosed and is tall and lean.

relationships.description: Harry notices a witch who turns out to be a younger Rita Skeeter. This is described as Harry understanding that it was a different memory, day, and trial.
Harry is sitting beside Dumbledore in the trial. This is described as Harry looking around to see who was there with him.
Harry sees Mr. Crouch sitting in the trial, looking more tired and fiercer than before. This is described as Harry understanding that it was a different memory, day, and trial.
Harry sees Ludo Bagman walking into the room. This is described as Harry observing that it was not a Ludo Bagman gone to seed, but one who was at the height of his Quidditch-playing fitness.
Rita Skeeter is described as being noticed by Harry. This is described as Harry understanding that it was a different memory, day, and trial.
Dumbledore is sitting beside Harry in the trial. This is described as Harry looking around to see who was there with him.
Mr. Crouch is sitting in the trial, looking more tired and fiercer than before. This is described as Harry understanding that it was a different memory, day, and trial.

Ludo Bagman walks into the room, and Harry observes him. This is described as Harry understanding that it was not a Ludo Bagman gone to seed, but one who was at the height of his Quidditch-playing fitness.
